title: Dog The Bounty Hunter pays tribute to late wife Beth Chapman for birthday
text:
Beth would have been 52 (Picture: Getty Images/Instagram)

Dog The Bounty Hunter has paid tribute to his late wife Beth Chapman, to mark what would have been her 52nd birthday, after she tragically lost her battle with throat cancer earlier in the year.

The 66-year-old took to Instagram to post a picture of the two sharing a sweet embrace as they stand by a porch.

The photo was a repost which was shared by Beth earlier in the year on her own account, in which she wrote: ‘Sooooo in love with this guy!’

Fans later took to the comments to share their condolences, while wishing Beth a happy birthday.

‘She loved you so much. Still does,’ one fan commented.

‘Bless you, my brother,’ another added.

‘We all miss her, happy birthday Beth,’ one chipped in.

‘One amazing woman. Happy birthday in heaven Beth, love strength and comfort are with the whole family,’ another wrote.

Dog shared a picture of the two sharing a sweet embrace (Picture: Instagram)

While one fan in particular opted to share a touching tribute.

‘Happy first birthday in heaven sweet beautiful Beth! We all love you and pray for your sweet husband and family everyday!’ they wrote.

‘Much love to you all and always know she is with you no matter what!’

It comes after Dog, real name Duane Chapman, was previously admitted to hospital in September after suffering a suspected heart attack – although Dog believes his hospitalisation was down to a ‘broken heart’ following his wife’s death.

‘I’m going through some things psychologically now so that doesn’t help,’ he said during an interview with FOX31.

‘I think basically I had a broken heart. And of course it’s going to heal.’

Now his family members have apparently urged him to change his lifestyle, with sources telling TMZ that they have asked the reality star to cut down on smoking and switch to a healthier diet, after he was said to have been diagnosed with ‘stress and high blood pressure’.

Dog previously opened up about Beth’s death, admitting that he and his children – Dominic Davis, 34, Cecily Chapman, 26, Bonnie Chapman, 20 and Gary Chapman, 18 – were ‘barely making it’ following her passing.

‘Each one copes differently, there is a few that really barely making it [sic],’ he told People Now.

‘We don’t know what to do. We haven’t read, we weren’t prepared.’

The two were best known for appearing together on Dog’s reality series Dog The Bounty Hunter, and Beth died while they were producing his current series, Dog’s Most Wanted.
